page.title: 10EDUCATION
page.content: There is one primary school in Witheridge.It is a merger of a former church school and a County Primary school which took place in 1965.In 1966 a new school was built for the junior department and the infants were left in the former County Primary building which is three hundreds yards away. The school caters for children aged from five to eleven and then they transfer to Chulmleigh comprehensive The facilities are very good.There is a large playing field shared with the Parish Council and used as a community resource.There is also a learner swimming pool which was completely enclosed by the P.T.A. a few years ago.The school also has its own canteen and provides meals for another school in the area.
